bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. LOWEY:H.R. 671.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I.[Page H688]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Global Health, Empowerment, and Rights Act or the HER Act

This bill states that foreign nongovernmental organizations shall not be ineligible for U.S. international development assistance under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 solely on the basis of health or medical services provided by such organizations with non-U.S. government funds if such services do not violate the laws of the country in which they are being provided and would not violate U.S. federal law if provided in the United States. Such organizations also shall not be subject to requirements relating to the use of non-U.S. government funds for advocacy and lobbying activities other than those that apply to U.S. nongovernmental organizations receiving such assistance under such Act.

bill.title: HER Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: HER Act

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Global Health, Empowerment, and Rights Act
Global Health, Empowerment, and Rights Act

To prohibit the application of certain restrictive eligibility requirements to foreign nongovernmental organizations with respect to the provision of assistance under part I of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

item.latestTitle: Global Health, Empowerment and Rights Act

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
